cards.name: The Fool
cards.uprightMeaning: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Fool reversed represents recklessness, carelessness, negligence, stupidity, distraction, apathy, irrationality and lack of fun.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.uprightMeaning: The Magician represents manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action and creativity. You have the tools and resources you need to manifest your desires.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Magician reversed represents manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents, lack of focus and wasted potential.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.uprightMeaning: The High Priestess represents intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, the subconscious mind and higher powers. Trust your intuition and inner voice.
cards.reversedMeaning: The High Priestess reversed represents secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal and silence, repressed feelings.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.uprightMeaning: The Empress represents femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing, abundance and creativity. She encourages you to connect with your feminine energy.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Empress reversed represents creative block, dependence on others, smothering, lack of growth and overbearing nature.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.uprightMeaning: The Emperor represents authority, establishment, structure, a father figure and leadership. He brings stability and order to your life.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Emperor reversed represents domination, excessive control, lack of discipline, inflexibility and abuse of power.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.uprightMeaning: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition and institutions. Seek guidance from a mentor or spiritual teacher.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Hierophant reversed represents personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo, unconventional approaches.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.uprightMeaning: The Lovers represents love, harmony, relationships, values alignment and important choices. A significant relationship or decision awaits.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Lovers reversed represents disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values, relationship problems.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.uprightMeaning: The Chariot represents control, willpower, success, determination and direction. You have the strength to overcome obstacles.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Chariot reversed represents lack of control, lack of direction, aggression, powerlessness.

cards.name: Strength
cards.uprightMeaning: Strength represents inner strength, courage, persuasion, influence and compassion. You have the power to overcome challenges through gentleness.
cards.reversedMeaning: Strength reversed represents self-doubt, lack of confidence, low energy, raw emotion.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.uprightMeaning: The Hermit represents soul searching, seeking truth, inner guidance and introspection. Take time for self-reflection and inner wisdom.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Hermit reversed represents isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, paranoia, misguided advice.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.uprightMeaning: The Wheel of Fortune represents good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny and a turning point. Positive change is coming.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Wheel of Fortune reversed represents bad luck, lack of control, clinging to control, unwelcome changes.

cards.name: Justice
cards.uprightMeaning: Justice represents justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, and law. You will receive what you deserve based on your actions.
cards.reversedMeaning: Justice reversed represents unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty, bias.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.uprightMeaning: The Hanged Man represents suspension, restriction, letting go, sacrifice and gaining a new perspective. Sometimes you must pause to move forward.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Hanged Man reversed represents delays, resistance, stalling, indecision.

cards.name: Death
cards.uprightMeaning: Death represents endings, beginnings, change, transformation and transition. One chapter ends so another can begin.
cards.reversedMeaning: Death reversed represents resistance to change, personal transformation, inner purging.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.uprightMeaning: Temperance represents balance, moderation, patience, purpose and finding meaning. Seek harmony and avoid extremes.
cards.reversedMeaning: Temperance reversed represents imbalance, excess, self-healing, re-alignment.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.uprightMeaning: The Devil represents bondage, addiction, sexuality, materialism and temptation. You may be trapped by your own limiting beliefs.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Devil reversed represents releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.uprightMeaning: The Tower represents sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation and awakening. Dramatic change will clear the way for new growth.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Tower reversed represents personal transformation, fear of change, averting disaster.

cards.name: The Star
cards.uprightMeaning: The Star represents hope, faith, purpose, renewal and spirituality. You are blessed with inspiration and hope for the future.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Star reversed represents lack of faith, despair, self-trust, disconnection.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.uprightMeaning: The Moon represents illusion, fear, anxiety, subconscious and intuition. Trust your intuition but be aware of deception.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Moon reversed represents release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.uprightMeaning: The Sun represents positivity, fun, warmth, success and vitality. Joy and success are coming your way.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Sun reversed represents inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.uprightMeaning: Judgement represents judgement, rebirth, inner calling, absolution and awakening. You are being called to a higher purpose.
cards.reversedMeaning: Judgement reversed represents self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call, lack of self-awareness.

cards.name: The World
cards.uprightMeaning: The World represents completion, integration, accomplishment and fulfillment. You have achieved your goals and found success.
cards.reversedMeaning: The World reversed represents seeking personal closure, short-cut to success, lack of achievement.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ace of Cups represents love, new relationships, compassion, creativity and emotional awakening. A new emotional beginning awaits.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ace of Cups reversed represents self-love, intuition, repressed emotions, emotional loss.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Two of Cups represents unified love, partnership, mutual attraction and deep connection. A meaningful relationship is forming.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Two of Cups reversed represents self-love, break-ups, disharmony, distrust.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Three of Cups represents celebration, friendship, creativity, collaborations and community. Enjoy time with friends and celebrate achievements.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Three of Cups reversed represents independence, alone time, hardcore partying, three's a crowd.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Four of Cups represents meditation, contemplation, apathy and reevaluation. Take time to reflect on your emotional state.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Four of Cups reversed represents retreat, withdrawal, checking in with yourself.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Five of Cups represents regret, failure, disappointment and loss. Focus on what remains rather than what is lost.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Five of Cups reversed represents personal setbacks, self-forgiveness, moving on.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Six of Cups represents revisiting the past, childhood memories, innocence and nostalgia. Happy memories bring comfort and joy.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Six of Cups reversed represents living in the past, forgiveness, lacking playfulness.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Cups represents opportunities, choices, wishful thinking and illusion. Many options are available but choose wisely.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Seven of Cups reversed represents alignment, personal values, overwhelmed by choices.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Cups represents disappointment, abandonment, withdrawal and seeking deeper truth. It's time to move on from what no longer serves you.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Eight of Cups reversed represents trying one more time, indecision, aimless drifting.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Cups represents contentment, satisfaction, gratitude and wish fulfillment. Your dreams are coming true.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Nine of Cups reversed represents inner happiness, materialism, dissatisfaction.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Cups represents divine love, blissful relationships, harmony and happiness. Perfect emotional fulfillment is achieved.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ten of Cups reversed represents disconnection, misaligned values, struggling relationships.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Page of Cups represents creative opportunities, intuitive messages, curiosity and new possibilities. Trust your creative instincts.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Page of Cups reversed represents new ideas, doubting intuition, creative blocks.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Knight of Cups represents creativity, romance, charm and imagination. Follow your heart and pursue your dreams.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Knight of Cups reversed represents overactive imagination, unrealistic, jealousy.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The Queen of Cups represents compassion, caring, emotional stability and intuitive healing. Trust your emotional intelligence.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Queen of Cups reversed represents inner compassion, self-care, co-dependency.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.uprightMeaning: The King of Cups represents emotional balance, compassion, diplomacy and wisdom. You have mastered your emotions.
cards.reversedMeaning: The King of Cups reversed represents self-compassion, inner feelings, moodiness.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ace of Wands represents inspiration, new opportunities, growth and creative potential. A new creative venture is beginning.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ace of Wands reversed represents an emerging idea, lack of direction, distractions.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Two of Wands represents future planning, making decisions and personal power. You have the world in your hands.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Two of Wands reversed represents personal goals, inner alignment, fear of unknown.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Three of Wands represents expansion, foresight, overseas opportunities and progress. Your efforts are paying off.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Three of Wands reversed represents playing small, lack of foresight, unexpected delays.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Four of Wands represents celebration, joy, harmony and homecoming. A time of happiness and stability.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Four of Wands reversed represents personal celebration, inner harmony, conflict with others.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Five of Wands represents conflict, disagreements, competition and tension. Healthy competition can lead to growth.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Five of Wands reversed represents inner conflict, conflict avoidance, releasing stress.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Six of Wands represents success, public recognition, progress and victory. Your achievements are being recognized.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Six of Wands reversed represents private achievement, self-validation, fall from grace.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Wands represents challenge, competition, protection and perseverance. Stand your ground and defend your position.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Seven of Wands reversed represents exhaustion, giving up, overwhelmed.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Wands represents movement, fast-paced change, action and alignment. Things are moving quickly in your favor.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Eight of Wands reversed represents delays, frustration, resisting change.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Wands represents resilience, courage, persistence and boundaries. You're almost at the finish line.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Nine of Wands reversed represents inner resources, struggle, overwhelm.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Wands represents burden, extra responsibility, hard work and completion. Success comes with responsibility.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ten of Wands reversed represents doing it all, carrying the burden, delegation.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Page of Wands represents inspiration, ideas, discovery and limitless potential. A new creative project is calling.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Page of Wands reversed represents newly formed ideas, redirecting energy, self-limiting beliefs.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Knight of Wands represents energy, passion, inspired action and adventure. Take bold action toward your goals.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Knight of Wands reversed represents passion project, haste, scattered energy.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The Queen of Wands represents courage, confidence, independence and determination. You have the power to achieve anything.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Queen of Wands reversed represents self-respect, self-confidence, introverted.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.uprightMeaning: The King of Wands represents natural leadership, vision, entrepreneurship and creative mastery. You are a born leader.
cards.reversedMeaning: The King of Wands reversed represents impulsiveness, haste, ruthless, high expectations.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ace of Swords represents breakthrough, clarity, sharp mind and new ideas. A moment of clarity cuts through confusion.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ace of Swords reversed represents inner clarity, re-thinking an idea, clouded judgement.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Two of Swords represents difficult decisions, weighing options and being at an impasse. Take time to consider all options.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Two of Swords reversed represents indecision, confusion, information overload.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Three of Swords represents heartbreak, emotional pain, sorrow and grief. Allow yourself to feel and heal.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Three of Swords reversed represents negative self-talk, releasing pain, optimism.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Four of Swords represents rest, relaxation, meditation and recuperation. Take time to recharge your energy.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Four of Swords reversed represents awakening, re-entering world, restlessness.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Five of Swords represents conflict, disagreements, competition and defeat. Consider if winning is worth the cost.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Five of Swords reversed represents reconciliation, making amends, past resentment.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Six of Swords represents transition, change, rite of passage and moving forward. You are moving toward calmer waters.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Six of Swords reversed represents personal transition, resistance to change, unfinished business.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Swords represents betrayal, deception and acting strategically. Someone may not be entirely honest.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Seven of Swords reversed represents imposter syndrome, self-deceit, keeping secrets.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Swords represents negative thoughts, self-imposed restrictions and victim mentality. You have more power than you realize.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Eight of Swords reversed represents self-limiting beliefs, inner critic, releasing negative thoughts.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Swords represents anxiety, worry, fear and nightmares. Your fears may be worse than reality.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Nine of Swords reversed represents inner turmoil, deep-seated fears, secrets.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Swords represents painful endings, deep wounds, betrayal and crisis. This is rock bottom, but recovery begins now.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ten of Swords reversed represents recovery, regeneration, resisting an inevitable end.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Page of Swords represents new ideas, curiosity, thirst for knowledge and new communication. Stay curious and open-minded.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Page of Swords reversed represents self-expression, all talk and no action, haste.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Knight of Swords represents ambition, action-oriented thinking and being driven to succeed. Act quickly but think first.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Knight of Swords reversed represents restless, unfocused, impulsive, burn-out.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The Queen of Swords represents independence, unbiased judgement, clear boundaries and direct communication. Speak your truth clearly.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Queen of Swords reversed represents self-defence, self-criticism, harsh judgement.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.uprightMeaning: The King of Swords represents mental clarity, intellectual power, authority and truth. Use your intellect and experience wisely.
cards.reversedMeaning: The King of Swords reversed represents quiet power, inner truth, misuse of power.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ace of Pentacles represents manifestation, new financial opportunity, abundance and prosperity. A new opportunity for material success.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ace of Pentacles reversed represents lost opportunity, lack of planning, bad investment.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Two of Pentacles represents multiple priorities, time management and adaptability. Balance is key to managing everything.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Two of Pentacles reversed represents over-committed, disorganisation, reprioritising.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Three of Pentacles represents collaboration, learning, implementation and teamwork. Work with others to achieve your goals.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Three of Pentacles reversed represents disharmony, misalignment, working alone.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Four of Pentacles represents saving money, security, conservatism and control. Financial security is important but don't be too restrictive.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Four of Pentacles reversed represents over-spending, greed, self-protection.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Five of Pentacles represents financial loss, poverty, lack mindset and worry. Help is available if you're willing to accept it.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Five of Pentacles reversed represents recovery from financial loss, spiritual poverty.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Six of Pentacles represents giving, receiving, sharing wealth and generosity. Balance giving and receiving in your life.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Six of Pentacles reversed represents self-care, unpaid debts, one-sided charity.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Pentacles represents long-term view, sustainable results, perseverance and investment. Your hard work will pay off.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Seven of Pentacles reversed represents lack of long-term vision, limited success.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Pentacles represents apprenticeship, repetitive tasks, mastery and skill development. Practice makes perfect.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Eight of Pentacles reversed represents self-development, perfectionism, misdirected activity.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Pentacles represents abundance, luxury, self-sufficiency and financial independence. Enjoy the fruits of your labor.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Nine of Pentacles reversed represents self-worth, over-investment in work, hustling.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Pentacles represents wealth, financial security, family and long-term success. Generational wealth and stability.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Ten of Pentacles reversed represents the fleeting nature of material wealth, family financial issues.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Page of Pentacles represents manifestation, financial opportunity, skill development and ambition. A new opportunity for growth.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Page of Pentacles reversed represents lack of progress, procrastination, learn from failure.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Knight of Pentacles represents hard work, productivity, routine and being methodical. Slow and steady wins the race.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Knight of Pentacles reversed represents self-discipline, boredom, feeling 'stuck', perfectionism.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing, being practical, providing financially and working parent energy. Balance work and family.
cards.reversedMeaning: The Queen of Pentacles reversed represents financial independence, self-care, work-home conflict.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.uprightMeaning: The King of Pentacles represents financial success, business leadership, security and abundance. You have achieved material mastery.
cards.reversedMeaning: The King of Pentacles reversed represents financially inept, obsessed with wealth, stubborn.
